venue.address_2: see map at end of announcement
venue.name: Building 4, Room 370

item.description:
Please RSVP!

What's Hot and What's Not led by Tom Hill

Tom leads a discussion on what trends, or themes, with their associated stock tickers are distinctly good for longs or shorts. He also shows what their performance has been. The focus will be on ETFs and stocks for asset classes, sectors, industry groups and indexes. In particular, we will be looking to hear from you to find out what you have surmised and found a way to trade on it.

Screening Using IBD (TM) Method Criteria led by Jeff Orrik

Jeff will use screens to discover valuable stock tickers. Some will be from the screens that Mike Kinkead uses in his IBD (TM) Method presentation. Other screens will be used to discover stock tickers that work well with other lists. The goal is to find stocks and ETFs at buy points while experimenting with the tools available on Investors.com and using the various talents of everybody in the room. Jeff will weave Blocks into his analysis.

Harlan Will Not Be Presenting His Market Update

Ming will fill in for this meeting. Harlan will be back in August. Please welcome Ming with his first formal presentation to the group - a market roundup. Ming will focus on the nature and extent of this bear market.

StockPicks led by Chris Jones

Eric announces which stocks performed best. Then we solicit all the picks from everyone and run through all them, with Jeff putting up the charts as we have done in the past. Afterwards we will focus on 5 of the stocks to be analyzed further and dissected by the group at large.

Day Trader's Pre-Meeting led by Eric Eklof

The Premeeting is 5:30 to 6:50 & arrive when you can. All are welcome & you don't have to be a Day Trader as the concepts apply to all trading.

BDTG= Boston Day Trader's Group is hosted by Eric from Vermont where actual trades, various skills and many vendors are discussed in detail. Plus all trading questions are answered or researched online so please bring your questions as all are important! Very simple "Price Pressure" trading is shared utilizing Candlestick recognition, resulting Patterns & established Trends.

Agenda:
5:30-6:50 Premeeting Period
- Daytraders Group led by Eric
7:00 - Meeting Begins:
- Announcements and Polls, led by Doug
- Market Roundup
- StockPicks led by Chris
- What's Hot and What's Not led by Tom
- Prospecting Using Investors.com led by Jeff

Our members value discussion highly. We try to pack as much discussion as possible. Expressing ideas and sharing knowledge is paramount to our members.
All levels of expertise are welcome. No question is too simple - as a matter of fact the simplest question often evokes the best discussion!

Newcomers gather at the podium during the 8:00 break to learn about the group. Welcome!

If you talk stocks with someone then bring them with you!

To join our online discussion go to
http://groups.google....
or send email to DouglasWRoberts@gmail.com.

The Virtual Trading game is up and running! Directions are at:
http://groups.google....
Note: Please be sure to choose a name that we can identify with you! Otherwise it is anonymous!

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you!

Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room.

Make your own investment decisions! Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone.

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.

IBD Group Rate for Upcoming Level 2 Seminar!
As a effort to help members get started on their own journey learning the IBD (TM) Method, we have secured a special offer from IBD for 33% off on the August 16 seminar in Boston! To learn more, go to this link: http://files.meetup.c...
item.name: Boston Investor's Business Daily Tuesday Meetup
